about.name: About
about.description:
Hi. I'm Amie!

My initial career upon entering the professional world was as an exercise physiologist. While I was running stress tests in a cardiology facility during the day, I was learning to code at night. I fell in love with it and decided to switch paths to become a front end web developer. I did some freelancing and worked at a digital marketing agency before deciding to further my coding education. In July I completed the Ruby on Rails Engineering program at The Iron Yard, and while I enjoyed learning about the server side, my heart still lies in the front end. Feel free to look around and contact me with any comments or questions!

greer-dailey.name: Greer Dailey
greer-dailey.description: Greer Dailey is a responsive website I worked on as a freelance project. I wrote all of the HTML and CSS using Handlebars.js and Sass.

shopper.name: Shopper
shopper.description: Shopper was my final project at The Iron Yard. I was responsible for the front end and wrote the HTML, CSS and some of the JavaScript. I used ERB and Sass.

moomill.name: MooMill
moomill.description: MooMill was a homework assignment for The Iron Yard and functionally is a clone of Twitter. I helped in both the front and back end of this project, using Ruby on Rails and Sass.

resume.name: Resume
resume.description: For more information on my education and experience, please see my resume in Codepen or in pdf format.
